meanings.definition: To install software or hardware before it is delivered to the end user.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to preinstall the new software on all computers before shipping them out.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice for manufacturers to preinstall necessary drivers on devices.
meanings.sent3: The tech team joked that they should preinstall a game on every computer for a surprise break.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to preinstall positivity in her mind every morning like a software update.
meanings.sent5: The idea to preinstall safety features in the car's design was revolutionary.

meanings.definition: Already installed on a device before it is sold or used.
meanings.sent1: The preinstalled software on the new phone made it ready to use right out of the box.
meanings.sent2: The preinstalled apps on the tablet saved the user time setting up their device.
meanings.sent3: He found it amusing that the preinstalled game on the console was his favorite.
meanings.sent4: The preinstalled memories on the camera captured moments before they even happened.
meanings.sent5: The preinstalled settings on the TV made it easy for anyone to start watching immediately.
